# isExclusiveTouch

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver handles touch events exclusively.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isExclusiveTouch: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Setting this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] causes the receiver to block the delivery of touch events to other views in the same window. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Configuring the event-related behavior

- **isUserInteractionEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether user events are ignored and removed from the event queue.
- **isMultipleTouchEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view receives more than one touch at a time.
